title: VCAT approves multi-billion-dollar Forest Hill project
excerpt: VCAT has granted planning permission to APH Holding for a multi-billion-dollar development at the corner of Burwood Highway and Springvale Road in Forest Hill.

sections.caption: Image credit: APH Holding

sections.content: VCAT has granted planning permission to [APH Holding](https://www.aphholding.com.au/) for a multi-billion-dollar development at the corner of Burwood Highway and Springvale Road in Forest Hill.
City Park, as it will be known, will be a master plan project comprising more than 50,000 sqm of retail, sports, entertainment, food and beverage, childcare, gyms, and health and wellness facilities.
A large convention centre and two hotels will also be constructed on the site.
APH Holding CEO, Johnson Zhang, expressed his delight at the decision, saying, 'Achieving a permit for City Park is an exciting milestone for both the team at APH Holding and the City of Whitehorse.'
'This development shows a vision for the future and will become an important business hub for the fast-growing eastern corridor of Melbourne.'
The planning decision marks a second recent win for APH Holding. The firm also signed a deal with Accor Hotels to deliver a new Novotel in Box Hill.
